description: Borrowed from Italian virtuoso, from Late Latin virtuōsus (“virtuous”), from Latin virtus (“excellence”). Doublet of virtuous.

adjectives.description: virtuoso (comparative more virtuoso, superlative most virtuoso)

entries.meaning: Exhibiting the ability of a virtuoso.
(now historical) An expert in virtù or art objects and antiquities; a connoisseur. [from 17th c.]
Someone with special skill or knowledge; an expert. [from 17th c.]
Specifically, a musician (or other performer) with masterly ability, technique, or personal style. [from 18th c.]
